description: Copyright  2013 Spectrum IT Solutions Gmbh - All Rights Reserved
Base actor class, defines all primitive methods and handles interactionswith the native engine. This merely represents a handle on an internal actor
Instantiates the actor in the engine, gets a handle for it
functions.name: constructor

description: De-registers the actor, clearing the physics and visual bodies.Note that the instance in question should not be used after this is called!
functions.name: destroy

description: Set our render layer. Higher layers render last (on top)Default layer is 0
functions.name: setLayer

description: Set our physics layer. Actors will only collide if they are in the samelayer! There are only 16 physics layers (1-16, with default layer 0)
Default layer is 0
Physics layers persist between physics body creations
functions.name: setPhysicsLayer

description: Return actor id
functions.name: getId

description: Modifies the position of the native object, and storesa local copy of it
functions.name: setPosition

description: Modifies the rotation of the native object, and storesa local copy of it
functions.name: setRotation

params.name: radians
params.description: set in radians, defaults to false

description: Returns the position of the object, as stored locally
functions.name: getPosition

description: Returns the rotation of the native object, as stored locally
functions.name: getRotation

params.name: radians
params.description: return in radians, defaults to false

description: Set actor color
functions.name: setColor

description: Get actor color
functions.name: getColor

description: Check if psyx simulation is enabled
functions.name: hasPsyx

description: Creates the internal physics body, if one does not already exist
functions.name: enablePsyx

description: Destroys the physics body if one exists
functions.name: disablePsyx

description: Attach a texture to the actor. This creates a square actor, textures it,and anchors it to ourselves. Use this when texturing actors that don'tcurrently directly support textures.
functions.name: attachTexture

description: Remove attached texture if we have one
functions.name: removeAttachment

description: Set attached texture visiblity
functions.name: setAttachmentVisible

description: This is called by AJS.mapAnimation(), which is in turn called byAJS.animate() when required. You shouldn't map your animations yourself,let AJS do that by passing them to AJS.animate() as-is.
Actors extending us should also extend this method to support animatingtheir unique properties.
Generates an engine-supported animation for the specified property andoptions. Use this when animating a property not directly supported bythe engine.
functions.name: mapAnimation

description: Checks if the property is one we provide animation mapping for
functions.name: canMapAnimation

description: Checks if the mapping for the property requires an absolute modificationto the actor. Multiple absolute modifications should never be performedat the same time!
NOTE: This returns false for properties we don't recognize
functions.name: absoluteMapping

return.description: absolute hope to the gods this is false

description: Schedule a rotation animationIf only an angle is provided, the actor is immediately and instantlyrotated
functions.name: rotate

description: Schedule a movementIf only target coordinates are provided, the actor is immediately andinstantly moved
If either coordinate is null, it is not modified
functions.name: move

description: Schedule a color changeIf only target components are provided the color is immediately set
If either coordinate is null, it is not modified
functions.name: colorTo

description: Copyright  2013 Spectrum IT Solutions Gmbh - All Rights Reserved
Implements a variable-side polygon actor. The android engine implementsthis natively!

NOTE: On WebGL, the radius and side-count should NEVER be animated at thesame time! This is a limitation of our vertice animations; side-countand radius modifications both require a complete vertex-recalculation,and as such are applied as absolute changes instead of relative oneslike width/height for AJSRectangle. Make sure your radius andsegment-count animations never overlap!

NOTE 2: Even when the radius and side-count are animated seperately, verystrange things will happen as a result of the uni-directional lineof communication between us and the engine. Animating the radius doesnot actually update our stored radius value. Sad pandas. The androidengine implements a polygon natively, and as such solves thisproblem. Expect your WebGL exports to behave strangely if you animateboth on the same object.
NOTE 3: Things work alright if you animate the radius first, then the segcount. Keep this in mind.
Set up vertices, with the resulting nGon centered around its position
functions.name: constructor

description: Creates the engine actor object
functions.name: interfaceActorCreate

description: Set radius. Enforces minimum, rebuilds vertices, and updates actor
functions.name: setRadius

description: Set segments. Enforces minimum, rebuilds vertices, and updates actor
functions.name: setSegments

description: Get radius
functions.name: getRadius

description: Get segment count
functions.name: getSegments

description: Copyright  2013 Spectrum IT Solutions Gmbh - All Rights Reserved
Top-level file, used by concat_in_order

As part of the build process, grunt concats all of our coffee sources in adependency-aware manner. Deps are described at the top of each file, with thisessentially serving as the root node in the dep tree.
AJS main class, instantiates the engine and provides access to common methodsShould never be instantiated, all methods are static.
AJS is a singleton, do not instantiate! Constructor throws an error.
functions.name: constructor

description: Initializes the engine with a specific screen size and ad lengthThe actual ad needs to be passed in as a method
functions.name: init

description: Set camera position. Leaving out a component leaves it unmodified
functions.name: setCameraPosition

description: Fetch camera position. Returns an object with x, y keys
functions.name: getCameraPosition

description: Set renderer clear color, component values between 0 and 255
functions.name: setClearColor

description: Returns the renderer clear color as an AJSColor3
functions.name: getClearColor

description: Override engine log level
functions.name: setLogLevel

description: Animates actor properties. Pass in either a single property, or an arrayof property definitions. The same goes for the animation options.
Composite properties (r of color rgb) must be animated individually, andspecified as an array of [property, composite].
When passing an animation start time, (< 0) signifies immediately, 0 noautomatic start, and (> 0) a start delay in ms from now.
Start and fps are only set on animations if they do not already exist!

examples.description: Animating the Y coordinate of an actor
Animating the rotation of an actor

functions.name: animate

params.name: start
params.description: optional, animation start time (applies to all)

description: Generates an engine-supported animation for the specified property andoptions. Use this when animating a property not directly supported bythe engine.
Note that AJS.animate() uses this internally upon encountering anunsupported property!
functions.name: mapAnimation

description: Load package.json source; used only by the WebGL engine, in turn loadstextures relative to our current path.
functions.name: loadManifest

functions.name: createCircleActor

description: Create a new triangle actor
functions.name: createTriangleActor

description: Copyright  2013 Spectrum IT Solutions Gmbh - All Rights Reserved

This class implements some helper methods for function param enforcementIt simply serves to standardize error messages for missing/incompleteparameters, and set them to default values if such values are provided.
Since it can be used in every method of every class, it is created staticand attached to the window object as 'param'
Defines an argument as required. Ensures it is defined and valid
functions.name: required

params.name: valid
params.description: optional array of valid values the param can have

description: Defines an argument as optional. Sets a default value if it is notsupplied, and ensures validity (post-default application)
functions.name: optional

params.name: def
params.description: default value to use if necessary

params.name: valid
params.description: optional array of valid values the param can have
